document_data.name: Renn min Zann
document_data.mainbody:
refs5e         =
}}Imam '''Renn min Zann''' was the highest representative of the assembled [[Enlightenment|Enlightened faiths]] throughout all of [[Zakhara]]. His official title was "Keeper of the Mosques," and he worked in golden [[Huzuz]], the City of Delights.
document_data.Description: Renn min Zann was described as a silver-haired fixture of court life, owing to the longevity of his race. Despite being short of stature, his presence demanded respect.
document_data.Personality: The imam was a very pragmatic man and gained a healthy reputation for his wisdom and ability to mediate between the [[moralist]]s, [[pragmatist]]s, and [[ethoist]]s.He spent equal time at the [[Golden Mosque]], the [[Court of Enlightenment]], and the [[Mosque of Zann the Wise]] in Huzuz.
document_data.Possessions: Renn possessed an ''[[robe of protection|aba of protection +4]]'', ''[[ring of spell turning]]'', ''[[ring of truth]]'', ''[[rod of resurrection]]'', ''[[gem of seeing]]'', and a ''[[staff of devotion]]''.
document_data.History: Renn was the son of a barbarian [[elf]] from the distant north and the [[elven]] daughter of a well-known [[Zakharan]] merchant. A longtime presence in the political circles of Huzuz, the imam served the current [[Grand Caliph]], [[Khalil al-Assad al-Zahir]], as well as his father and grandfather.
